revision.text:
{{Wireless embedded system |brand=AsiaRF |model=WS2977 |revision=(MT7623) |asin= |manuf_country=China |is_manuf=Yes |availability=now |est_release_date=02/06/2016 |fcc_date= |fcc_id=TKZWS2977 |type=wireless embedded board, single-board computer |pwr_v=12 |pwr_amp=2 |pwr_conn=barrel |cpu1_brand=MediaTek |cpu1_model=MT7623NI |cpu1_cspeed=1.3 GHz |cpu1_cores=4 |fla1=2 GiB |fla1_brand= |fla1_model=eMMC/NAND |fla1_num= |ram1=2 GiB |ram1_brand=Nanya |ram1_model=DDR3 |ram1_num=2 |expansion_if_types=Mini PCIe, USB 2.0, USB 3.0, |expansion_minipcie_num=3 |expansion_usb_num=2 |jtag=yes,, 20-pin header,, |serial=yes,, 4-pin header,, UART1,, |wi1_chip1_brand=MediaTek |wi1_chip1_model=MT6625L |wi1_802dot11_protocols=bgn |wi1_ant_conn=U.FL |wi1_txchains=1 |wi1_rxchains=1 |wi1_sstreams=1 |eth_none= |eth_cpu=true |eth_chip2_brand=IC+ |eth_chip2_model= |sw_cpu= |sw_brand=MediaTek |sw_model=MT7530WU |lan_speed=1GbE |lan_ports=4 |wan_speed=1GbE |wan_ports=2 |addl_chips= |flags=HDMI, MIPI, SD Card slot, |stock_boot= |stock_os= |tp_firmware= |802dot11_protocols=bgn |default_ssid= |default_ssid_regex= |default_ip= |default_user= |default_pass= |oui= |oui_eth= }} {{TagLine|Geek Force Gateway Board}} :[https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/geek-force-the-1st-android-and-linux-router-board#/ Product page] (Indiegogo) "WS2977" and "MT7683 RFB_V1.0" is silkscreened on the board in the photos. ===Features=== *Multimedia Network Router System *Quad-core ARM Cortex-A7 @1.3GHz, big DRAM bandwidth *Interfaces included HDMI, MIPI, PCIe 2.0, USB 2.0, USB 3.0 *MT6625L provided 11bgn WLAN and Bluetooth, PCIe can be added :on 11ac and more WLAN connections to do like concurrent linking ===Reviews=== *[http://www.cnx-software.com/2016/02/08/98-geek-force-mediatek-mt7623-router-board-features-6-gbe-ports-and-3-mpcie-slots-for-wifi-3g-and-lte-connectivity/ ''$98 Geek Force Mediatek MT7623 Router Board Features 6 GbE Ports,
3 mPCIe Slots for WiFi, 3G, or LTE (Crowdfunding)'' on '''CNX-Software'''] :*SoC: [[MediaTek]] [https://www.mediatek.com/products/homeNetworking/mt7623n-a MT7623N/A] @1.3GHz (quad-core ARM Cortex-A7) ::with Mali-450MP GPU (MT7623N only) :*System Memory: 2GB (DDR3), Storage: 2Gb (eMMC or NAND Flash), ::SD card slot up to 128 GB, and maybe SATA via the mPCIe slots :*WLAN: [[MediaTek]] MT6625L 802.11bgn Wi-Fi & BT 4.0 with IPEX ::for Wi-Fi and BT, optional 802.11ac Wi-Fi, 3G/4G via mPCIe slots :*Connectivity: 6x GbE ports (WAN / LAN behavior defined by firmware) :*USB: 1x USB 3.0 port, 1x USB 2.0 Host port, 1x micro USB OTG port :*Expansion: 3x mini PCIe, 26-pin “Raspberry Pi”, 10-pin PCM/SPIO, ::6-pin Apple Auth CP (I2C) connector, 10-pin I2C/I2S, Power header ::*Video: 2x HDMI (one in, one out), 1x RCA video output, MIPI DSI ::*Audio: HDMI port, and optical S/PDIF input and output ports :*Debugging: 20-pin JTAG, 4-pin UART1 connector for serial console :*Misc: IR receiver, power switch, 1x user switch :*Power: 12V ==Images== ---- [[Has images::internal| ]] __NOTOC__
